title-group.article-title: Test Procedures for the Evaluation of Aerodynamic Drag on Full-Scale Vehicles in Windy Environments

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright Â© Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc. 1977

abstract.p: Procedures for conducting full-scale coast down tests for the purpose of determining the aerodynamic drag forces on tractor-trailer trucks are presented. Tests were conducted on the baseline vehicle and on the baseline vehicle modified with drag reduction devices. Techniques for the evaluation of mechanical drag forces prior to the coast-down tests are given and a description of the instrumentation is included.

ref.mixed-citation: L.C. Montoya and L.L. Steers, "Aero- dynamic Drag Reduction Tests on a Full-Scale Tractor-Trailer Combination with Several Add-On Devices." NASA TMX-56028, December 1974.

P.B.S. Lissaman and J.H. Lambie, "Reduction of Aerodynamic Drag of Large Highway Trucks." Proceedings of the NSF/DOT Conference on Reduction of the Aerodynamic Drag of Trucks, California Institute of Technology, Pasadena, California, October 1974.
J.W. Anderson, J.C. Firey, P.W. Ford, and W.C. Kieling, "Truck Drag Components by Road Test Measurement." SAE Transactions, Vol. 73, p. 148, 1965.

F.T. Buckley and W.S. Sekscienski, "Comparisons of Effectiveness of Commercially Available Devices for the Reduction of Aerody- namic Drag on Tractor-Trailers." Proceedings of SAE West Coast Meeting, Seattle, Washington, August 1975.

C.H. Marks, F.T. Buckley, and W.H. Wals ton, "An Evaluation of the Aerodynamic Drag Reductions Produced by Various Cab Roof Fairings and a Gap Seal on Tractor-Trailer Trucks." Proceedings of 1976 SAE Automotive Engineering Congress, Detroit, February 1976.

F.T. Buckley, W.H. Wals ton, and C.H. Marks, "Analysis of Coast-Down Data to Assess the Aerodynamic Drag Reduction on Full-Scale Tractor-Trailer Trucks in Windy Environments." Proceedings of 1976 SAE Automotive Engineering Congress, Detroit, February 1976.
P.B. MacCready and H.R. Jex, Response Characteristics and Meteorological Utilization of Propeller and Vane Wind Sensors." Journal of Applied Meteorology, Vol. 3, p. 182, 1964.
